creator: Felix.Meschberger@daynetwork.com
text:
I try to use the Jasper parser within my own project with a custom built
implementation of ParseEventListener. As the files I want to parse contain tags
of the form <prefix:tagName> the parser calls the
ParseEventListener.getTagLibraries() method.

If I wanted to handle the tags as custom tags I would have to return a
TagLibraries object. If I wouldn't want to, I might return null. Both solutions
present problems :

(1) Returning a new TagLibraries object is not possible, because the constructor
is not accessible outside the org.apache.jasper.compiler package. Maybe the
constructor should be made public ?

(2) Returning null from ParseEventListener.getTagLibraries() will throw a
NullPointerException because accepting the custom tags in Parser.Tag.accept()
does not check for null TagLibraries. A fixing solution might be to check for
null results.

Looking at the possibilities I would suggest to fix the TagLibraries class to
declare the constructor public (I checked tomcat-3.2.2-b1, tomcat-3.3-m2 as well
as the nightly builds of tomcat-3.x and tomcat-4.0-dev. Ann all still contain
the same code in that respect).

Thank you very much !

Felix Meschberger
Development, Day Management
Basle, Switzerland

creator: Felix.Meschberger@daynetwork.com
text:
Sorry for the inconvenience. I didn't check correctly. It seems that in tomcat-
3.3 the TagLibraries constructor is public and thus usable.

For me the problem is solved.

Thank you very much for your time.

Felix Meschberger
